Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of doe (forepart remaining), grazing to right; at right, siren with outspread wings (part of wing and tail remaining), to right; below, glazed.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the deer, compare the band cup, Munich 2195 (CVA Munich 11, pl. 36, no. 1-5; Vierneisel, K. and Kaeser, B., Kunst der Schale. Kultur des Trinkens. Munich 1990, 31, no. 2.13.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.2)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 408, no. B617)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0520) (Phase 1)
